headline: Sweet Potato Pie VII
description: You can really taste the sweet potatoes in this creamy wonderful pie. There 's buttermilk stirred into the filling and a bit of baking soda, sugar, eggs, flour, and a smidgen of butter. There 's a bit of vanilla, but no spices, so the finished pie is mostly sweet potato.
name: Sweet Potato Pie VII
recipeIngredient: 2 cups cooked and mashed sweet potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix together mashed sweet potatoes, butter or margarine, and eggs. In a separate bowl, mix together sugar, flour, and salt. Mix in spices if desired. Add to sweet potato mixture and stir well.
Mix together buttermilk and baking soda. Add to sweet potato mixture and stir well. Mix in vanilla extract. Pour filling into pastry shell.
Bake in preheated oven for 70 minutes, until set in center.

review.reviewBody: Bake sweet potatoes. Use evaporated milk, brn and wht sugar totaling 3/4c. Cinnamon, nutmeg 1/2 tsp. gloves, ginger 1/8 tsp. Add 2 tabl of cognac..Makes a 5 ðŸŒŸ ðŸ¥§!!

I have been making this recipe for a number of years. This is my go to recipe because it focuses on just the sweet potato with all the spices that you would add to a pumpkin pie. The only thing I do different is use brown sugar in stead regular granular sugar.
Simple & Delicious! I added pumpkin pie spice & cinnamon to mine. Soooo goooood!!

Added nutmeg/cinnamon. 
Made twice - one day I used used can milk instead of buttermilk.
Very tasty and everyone loved it. 
Add sugar according to your taste.
I love but I didnâ€™t change anything about it

This was an amazingly delicious and subtle sweet potato pie, one I have made over and over. Simple to make, I also enjoyed playing with the spices to produce the best pie for your family's tastes (which is an excellent reason to make multiple pies, testing each one ;-). The only caveat is to not do what I did the first time... it says to mash the sweet potatoes so I took a handy manual potato masher and went to town. Unfortunately, there is no way to get a super-smooth consistency that way and we weren't thrilled with the pieces of sweet potato we occasionally bit into. I've learned- mashing means using electric beaters in this case and it has always been highly successful in my following attempts. I love this, strongly recommend it, and thank the lovely cook who shared it!
I didn't know how much spices to use. I"m baking pie now without spices. Don't know how to rate right now because it"s baking without spice but the raw pie tasted ok.
I decreased the amount of sugar since the sweet potatoes were sweet. I started with a half cup of sugar and adjusted as needed.
easy to make and family loved it
easy to make and family loved it

I have made this several times now. The first time I followed the recipe to the letter and found the pie was not quite firm enought and far to sweet for me. My potatos were really sweet. The second time I cut back on the sugar and used s mixture of potatos - some boiled some baked and this resolved the texture issue. I am making again today, have boiled, peeled potatos in advance. They are refrigerated now and I will drain off any excess liquid from the potatos before I mix. These potatos weren't as sweet so I have to decide about the sugar - we don't like it too sweet!
I added 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1 1/4 tsp of cinnamon and this turned out great! My girl was hesitant to try, but she did and even had seconds. Highly recommended.

My first sweet potato pie. Itâ€™s hard to get buttermilk in China but I make milk kefir so I substituted that for buttermilk. Others mentioned pumpkin pie spice well also not available so I made my own. Cinnamon,allspice,ginger and nutmeg and butter for the crust. Next time I will cut back on the sugar which I do in slot of recipes. Turned out very nice.

I used sweet potatoes from our garden and substituted 1/2 cup light brown sugar and 1/8 cup white for the 1 cup white sugar. I didnâ€™t have buttermilk so I used 1/2 tablespoon lemon juice and added whole milk to make 1/2 cup sour milk. I added 1/8 teaspoon ginger, cinnamon and nutmeg. It was delicious. I will definitely make this again.

Made this exactly as per recipe except substituted plain yogurt for buttermilk as one reviewer suggested. VERY dry. Needed more liquid from the start. Even putting it into the pie shell......it was basically spooning in dry mashed potatoes. I did bake my own sweet potatoes, perhaps it would be moister with canned. Pie was already "set" going into the oven, and then just proceeded to crack at that point. After reading some other recipes that use evap milk, I think I'll try one of those next time. I actually did add about 1/4 cup milk to this when I saw how dry it was, but it didn't help much. Disappointed as I was making it specially for a guest at Thanksgiving. Tasted ok I guess. Mild flavor, not too spicy which was nice. Served with plenty of whipped cream to offset dryness.
I doubled the recipe to accommodate more for more pies. I will use this recipe again. I did add extra flavorings.

I love the recipe and so did all my friends. The texture was exceptional. I added cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger, same amounts as on the Libby's pumpkin can for pumpkin pie. I used a bit more sweet potato than called for, as I like a deep pie. so I also added a couple of tablespoons of egg whites. and a little extra baking soda, and maybe a little extra buttermilk. I often play it by ear when cooking and baking! Otherwise, just follow the recipe.
It was very smooth and not overly sweet which we loved.
Instead of sweet potato I used butternut squash, It was so good the first time I made it, I had to make it again.

This was fantastic! I took a few othersâ€™ recommendations and added 1/2 brown sugar and 1/2 white and also 1/4 tsp.pumpkin pie spice. I had baked 4 small sweet potatoes, wrapped in foil, for 90 minutes at 350Â° the day before, then mashed them. I highly recommend this recipe!

Iâ€™ve never made sweet potato pie before and my husband loves it so I searched threw a few recipes and decided to use this one and Iâ€™m so glad I did! Only thing I changed was I added about a healthy hand full of brown sugar and omg itâ€™s soooo good! Iâ€™m glad I bought enough ingredients to make two because this one wonâ€™t last the night! ??????
No

I roasted the potatoes. They fell out of their skins. I also added a bit of nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves and ginger. I also doubled the vanilla. And made the buttermilk 3/4 cup. It was the best sweet potato pie I have ever made or ever had! But I substantially dressed up the recipe.

I've made this Sweet Potato Pie probably 10 times and never left a review. This is one delicious pie and very easy to make. I do add Cinnamon and Nutmeg about a teaspoon of both. Try this recipe you won't be disappointed.

The first time I ever had sweet potato pie was at a potluck and it tasted like wet cardboard!!! I was very shy about trying one again and had no desire to make one, but I have a sweet ten year old who begged me for one. Low and behold, I tried this recipe, added the teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice and oh mylanta!!! It is so good, itâ€™ll make your tongue slap your brains out! Iâ€™ll definitely make this again!!!
Excellent pie, you won't be disappointed.

This is the recipe my husband uses, he is a firm believer in buttermilk and this was one of the only ones that uses it. He adds 1/2 tea of cinnamon and 1/2 of nutmeg. Itâ€™s very yummy, even great grandma was impressed

The texture and overall taste of this piece is excellent. I would give it 5 stars except it is too sweet. I lessened the sugar to 3/4 cup and added 2 Tbs molasses (to make it more like brown sugar.) Still too sweet. Next time, I would still use the 2Tbs molasses, but lessen the sugar to 1/2 cup. If I could give 4.5 stars, I would, since I think this is a very minor issue. I added 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice. I will definitely make this again.

I alter the ingredients a little... I use 2% Milk instead of Buttermilk, and Brown Sugar instead of White Sugar... I also added cinnamon and used a Graham Cracker crust... Turned out "GREAT"... Family loved it...
SWEET PO
This is the best sweet potato pie I've ever had!

I have made this pie for the last five years. My husband doesn't want any other one. The first year I made it, I put 2 cups of flour instead of 2 tablespoons. My mistake turned in to my daughter's favorite, sweet potato muffins. But I still had to make the pies.

I'm from the North and never had Sweet Potato Pie until moving to NC in 2000. Now I say...what is pumpkin ?? This is my VERY FIRST attempt at making Sweet pp and my boyfriend says it's almost perfect... he's born n raised in NC!! I TOTALLY recommend this recipe.... easy peasy had I known I would have made one years ago!! 

THANK YOU SOOOOO MUCH for your getting me 2 thumbs up!!!
I love the pie I made my family

This is a great recipe. This is my go to recipe for sweet potato pie. This pie is delicious and my family loves it. I double the recipe because one pie is never enough. The only change I make is I use Brown sugar in stead of white.

No Substitutions! LOL
I made this pie with no substitutions. All I can say is Ooh LA LA!!!! 
I totally disagree with the person who said the pie was too sweet, the pie is perfect the way it's written.
I made this at my sons request for his friend, his friend was craving a homemade sweet potato pie. I made 2 with this recipe, one plain and one topped with caramelized pecans with my own rolled out pie crust. Needless to say he loved them.
Thank you for the wonderful recipe.

I didn't make any changes. when I was mixings all the ingredients the mix was soupy like and my husband and I was saying the mix was too wet and the pie my not set. we waited and when it cooled off it was perfect! it have a great taste with the right amount of spices. this is an amazing pie we love.
I added less sugar and some Cumin and cinnamon. It was very good
I made this recipe exactly as written and it was wonderful. I may add a tiny bit of spices next time though.
No changes but texture didn't look like the picture that you had with it.
I used Splenda instead of sugar. Added nutmeg and cinnamon to taste.
It reminds me of the carrot souffle recipe. I added more cinnamon and dash of nutmeg!

Very good foundation of a southern classic sweet potato pie. However I used 1 stick of butter. I followed directions to the "t" other than that but after making would definitely do some things different. For example, only one cup of sugar in recipe but pie could have been sweeter. Next time will increase to 1 1/2 cups of sugar. Secondly I would add more vanilla and add cinnaman even though the recipe doesn't call for it. Buttermilk kept it moist. Great foundation but definitely season to taste.

Easy quick recipe. I didn't have buttermilk so I substituted yogurt. it came out ok. I will try buttermilk next time. i will also use less sugar. It was a little too sweet for me. Other than that it was good. I will make it again.
Delicious! This recipe is fantastic and I use it year after year. I do add some cinnamon and a tiny bit of nutmeg. ??????
Did not change one thing. Fanatic.
Used a graham cracker crust...and my customers just loved them, will definitely do it again!

My new go to sweet potato pie! Reduced the sugar by 1/4 cup, added 1 teaspoon nutmeg and 1/8 teaspoon cinnamon, perfect for my taste. Very easy to make. One other note; I always peel, cut in 1 - 1/2 inch cubes and steam my sweet potatoes. Another reviewer mentioned baking, which is also a good idea, these cooking methods keep more flavor in the potato.
Traditional sweet potato pie recipe!! My husband loves it, won't eat the spiced pies, this is his favorite. I used 1/2 brown and white sugar. Buttermilk is a must!
I was brought up in my grandmother's homemade pie but this one of the best I've had since. I added nutmeg and cinnamon

A friend gave me a bag of white organic yams and I decided to give this recipe a shot. I used half white and half brown sugar and also added cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and allspice. Its a hit....i will definitely use this as my "go to" recipe for pies. Thanks for the submission

Great recipe! My husband doesn't like pumpkin, and I liked it better than pumpkin pie. On the trial run, I made 2 pies for his co-workers; they loved it, but I found it too sweet. I adjusted the recipe by using 1/2 c. sugar; 1/4 c. brown; 2TB molasses. Then I added a shot of bourbon and spiced it to my taste. It was amazing.
I followed the recipe perfectly but the pie was too sweet (i'd lower sugar to 3/4 of a cup) and was EXTREMELY mushy.
Made with 1/4 tsp each or ground cinnamon and ginger. It was truly scrumptious!
This was a very good pie, however it was a bit sweet for out tastes even though I reduced the sugar to 3/4. Next time I will at least 1/2 it.
Thanks for giving me an outline to make my squash pie. So, I used acorn squash and regular milk because I had no buttermilk. It smells great so we will see. 30 minutes to go!
Mom and Dan loved it.
I've never had sweet potato pie and this is awesome! I did change the amount of sugar to only 1/2 cup just cause I didn't ant to lose the taste of the sweet potato. This is a keeper Thank you

I didn't know how many sweet potatoes to cook, so i cooked three bigger ones, subsequently forgot to measure the mashed sweet potatoes, and ended up with enough filling for two pies, which still turned out good.
Huge hit at my house. My boyfriend can't get enough.
I grew my own sweet potatoes for this. This recipe was so good, even though I accidentally under-cooked the sweet potatoes before mashing. Everyone loved it!
This came out really great! I used 2/3 c. demerara sugar, in place of the 1 c. white sugar and the sweetness was just right. I also used gluten free ap flour in place of the regular ap flour.
Good. Easy to make, but a bit too sweet.

This was pretty great as is, but it made way more filling than my pie shell could hold? I guess maybe I should've used a deeper pie plate but I ended up making a couple of tarts too with what crust dough I had left -- I still had to pour some of the filling out! Man. I suspect this would probably fill two relatively shallow pies or like three full sized tart pans. So just maybe keep that in mind when you're making preparations for crust. Still, super delicious, especially with some vanilla ice cream. Great way to use up mashed sweet potato! (I suspect the sweet potato I used may have already had some butter or somesuch mashed into it, so maybe that contributed to my abundance of filling? Either way it baked up fine, we just had too much of it.)
Made this for the first time tonight. Awesome..and I'm not easily impressed! Wouldn't change a thing.

I'd never eaten or made sweet potato pie before, and was looking for a different way to use up some surplus sweet potatoes. What a great recipe! Just sweet enough, and the perfect consistency. I loved it. I did add one half teaspoon of cinnamon, which didn't overpower the sweet potato flavor at all. Tastes best after it's been cooled to room temp or slightly chillier, and settled for a day. Will definitely make this again.

I made it exactly as the recipe called for except I just added all ingredients, one by one, to the mixer. Whisked in the mixer until most of the lumps of potatoes were gone. Cook time was exactly as recipe stated - and I can't wait to find out how it tastes! Seems a keeper!!! :)
Wonderful recipe. Followed it but added about a teaspoon of lemon juice. Will surely make it again for Christmas.
Instead of buttermilk, I used soy egg nog...turned out amaaaazing!!

I mistakenly left the butter out of the recipe. Once the pies were in the oven, I realized that I forgot to add the softened butter. The pie tasted and looked GREAT, as if nothing was missing! Easy way to save on calories, and not sacrifice taste or consistancy!

This pie was part of my Thanksgiving meal and it was DELICIOUS!! I had a slice for breakfast on the day after. I added all ingredients as noted and added the cinnamon and nutmeg to my taste buds and it was fabulous!
In the process of making this pie now. I did add cinnamon and nutmeg to it. We will see how it turns out... Expecting greatness.
Very good recipe. Just double all ingredients for two pie crust.

I make a lot of pies for my man, but had yet to make a sweet potato pie. He made the request for pie and I decided to try something new. After searching AR awhile I came across this recipe...

Oh. My. God. It was perfect. Mine cooled overnight, but it was set up when I pulled it out of the oven! 

For the most part, I followed the directions. There's a couple minor tweaks I made though:
1. To cook my sweet potatoes, I simply stabbed them and baked them in the microwave. Easiest, fastest, and to me best way to cook em up.
2. I cut the bake time from 70 minutes to just 60 minutes. The top of my pie was a dark orange/brown.
3. To spice the pie (since the recipe leaves that up to you) I used three spices (in order from most amount, to least amount): cinnamon, nutmeg, & ginger. I only use approx. 1/4 teaspoon of ginger, and just went up from there. It all depends on your taste!

I was super nervous making the pie, my 'mashed' sweet potatoes didn't look anything like they should, they were clumpy. But, it baked up very well and we like a little texture to our pie. If you want it smooth I'd recommend using a hand mixer with the buttermilk to smooth it out!

Very, very good!
Love it! Added a half of a capful of rum extract, soooo good
I loved it for a basic guide i did add all spice, nutmeg, cinnamon, and rum to the recipe turned out great took a little longer to cook but yum

Followed the recipe exactly and really no taste. Needs some type of spice for flavor. Very disappointed as the reviews state otherwise. Will try another sweet potato pie recipe as this truly lacks flavor.
Easy and delicious. I add a teaspoon of vanilla extract, a teaspoon of cinnamon and a little freshly grated nutmeg.
This recipe was great! the only thing I did different was in place of buttermilk I used whole milk mixed with cream of tartar at room temp. delicious! big hit with the family.
I didn't not realize I was out of flour so I made the pie without it and it still came out really good. Other than that I did not change the recipe.

I made this a couple of days ago for my mother and she is the reason I'm giving this four stars. I made only one change and that was to add more sugar and nutmeg. Didn't really have the taste I'm used to but everyone liked it. I will use some of these ideas with the recipe I normally use. Thanks for sharing.
the best ever!

I've never made a sweet potato pie before -- actually, I'm not even sure I've ever tasted one -- but this was hands-down one of the BEST pies I've ever made or eaten. Easy to make, too! I used freshly-cooked and mashed sweet potatoes from my farmer's market, and the pie came out out light and fluffy and not-too-sweet, and just...WOW. I may never made a pumpkin pie for Thanksgiving again now that I've had this. :)
This was the first time I'd had sweet potato pie. It was AMAZING. I'm totally addicted now.
Really good pie. Never made Sweet Potato before. Would give this a 5 but a little sweet for my liking. Would cut back on sugar to 3/4 cup next time I make this.

The husband is a major pumpkin pie fan, but once he got a taste of this his loyalties turned. I went all out using organic sweet potatoes and Irish butter. I used cinnamon, vanilla, and a tablespoon of grated fresh ginger. It didn't need the 70 minutes. I bake in a convection oven. I pulled it at 63. It was perfect.
This recipe is wonderful. It is easy to make and delicious! I used this recipe to make my very first sweet potato pie and it was fantastic. My husband, my kids, and my husband's friends all loved it.

I'm a big fan of sweet potato pies and this recipe is a real winner. Here are a few suggestions: try baking the potatoes instead of boiling. It will give them a slightly sweeter taste, thus allowing you an option to reduce the added sugar. PurÃ©e potato mixture in food processor or blender for a lighter silkier texture. Add spices: cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger ( I used 1/4 t of each for a doubled recipe. Lastly, press a few broken pecan pices into the bottom of pie shell before filling.

i made this recipe for thanksgiving to try something different. i have another recipe that i'd used for years that was good. it was sooooo good. i did add 1 t. of pumpkin pie spice as others suggested. it was the perfect amount of spice. i also roasted my sweet potatoes, as another had suggested. it was so creamy and smooth. i was really excited. my family has asked me to make it again for christmas. :-)

Very good recipe for left over sweet potatoes or yams. I used yams and added ground cloves, fresh ground nutmeg, and a little allspice. The buttermilk gave it a nice tartness and I used less butter than stated for no other reason than to cut the fat in it. I too added Splenda vs. sugar.
This pie tasted so amazing! After trying this pie, I don't think I'll ever make another pumpkin pie. Thanks for the great recipe!

This recipe is wonderful. I made this for Thanksgiving and the taste is awesome. I have never made a sweet potato pie without any spices and i was kind of unsure, but i am so glad that i used this recipe. I think that the spices was taking over the sweet potatoes. This is my new way of making it. Thank you Kimberly, for sharing
First time making and it was excellent! I added some pumpkin spice and nutmeg. I also took the advice of someone on here and did half brown sugar half regular sugar. Very very tasty!
Absolutely Delicious- followed recipe exactly!

I did this same recipe 2 years in a row and my family LOVES IT!!!! I add a little nutmeg and cinnamon but the original recipe is AWESOME!!!!

Update: 5 years since my last review and my family STILL LOVES these pies!! I make at least 6 of them every year now with people claiming one for their own!! This is my favorite !

Great recipe. I am diabetic and was searching for a lower fat but great tasting way to eat more sweet potatoes. This buttermilk recipe is the best I have found. I added one tsp of Pumpkin Pie Spice and put the chopped pecans on the floor of the pie crust before putting the filling in. I covered the entire edge of the pie crust so it didn't get burned during the 70 minute cooking time and substituted Splenda for the white sugar. Fantastic results and the best low fat sweet potato pie I have found. Thanks.

The best sweet potato pie ever.. I did add cinnamon and nutmeg, I also used 3/4 cup of brown sugar instead of 1 cup of white sugar.. The buttermilk did something amazing to this pie, yummy!!
Thanks Kimberly!! =))
This was very easy and very tasty. Everyone enjoyed it and it was especially good using a homemade crust from an old cookbook. Nice change from the standard pumpkin pie.
I love this recipe. My fiancee is not a big fan of sweet potato pie, but she will eat this one. Thanks!
